Just to be clear: Zoro must specifically pick an outsider, minion and townsfolk on the same night in order for them to be drunk.

You learn nothing tonight, but you learn info on that player tomorrow if you don’t nominate and an execution goes through. If you do, you learn info on the new nominee so long as they are not executed. The trick to playing this role is to nominate somewhat frequently in a game where the majority of players are scared to nominate.

Washerwoman or Librarian sees Imp/Spy as only Outsider/Townsfolk bluff. I feel like no one ever solves that world when I do it. TB is lowkey the hardest of the base 3 to solve despite everyone thinking it’s “beginner friendly”. BMR you just follow the kills and see if it matches with the town’s abilities. SnV has a ton of broken info that becomes even easier if you figure out which demon is in play. TB’s minions are quiet and they can cause a ton of misinformation if the ST is clever.

Full Metal Alabasta

Thanks for the feedback, I made some changes

1. Thousand Sunny learns their info with four or less alive instead of five
2. Brook's ability is completely different. Now they learn a word each day and learn how many said it in town square that night.
3. Usopp no longer has OS modification. It's two characters that know each other are good regardless if they are poisoned.
4. Moria's ability is now worded "If the demon dies within the first two days, they keep their ability and the game continues until you die." TBH, Moria is probably just a SW in the OP world with their Shadow Fruit, but I tried to change it slightly in order to make their ability unique.

Douglas Bullet- Rebel Evil

The idea here, is that you pick a good player and then they kill themselves and win (Satanist swap happens before the evil team kills in the night order). Of course if you pick an evil player, that might not happen and you’ll look sus in final three.

If you are on the evil team, killing/poisoning the satanist is a must. Their ability is game-breaking but it doesn’t trigger until the final 5. If it is final 5, convince the Satanist to pick an evil player. The game will still continue and you can frame them in final 3 or end the game before that with an execution & 2 night deaths.
Satanist (Townsfolk): If there are 5 players or less, publicly choose a player (not yourself). They swap characters with the demon tonight.
One Piece
Seems redundant with Harborer and Diviner.

The idea here is that you pick a good player to become the Demon and then they kill themself. Of course, if you pick an evil player that’s not going to happen and you’ll be in an awkward situation in final 3.
Dungeon Master (Townsfolk): If there are four players alive or less, publicly choose a player (not yourself). They swap characters with the current demon tonight.
Simply by allowing an evil player to pit hag twice guarantees a dual demon set up after final 6.

Out of all Base 3 Scripts, BMR is the most fair. Both good and evil have to be active to push info or spread bullshit. All the info is out in the open, and it’s up to the good team to interpret it in a way that makes sense.
Joker (Minion): If the demon kills you. The storyteller can break the rules (once) to help the evil team.
